entry.title: You're a Computer Athlete (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

You're a Computer Athlete

You're likely a professional computer user – you should behave like the athlete that you are

entry.title: Using Tana's Supertags with Search (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Using Tana's Supertags with Search

Learn how to use Tana's supertags with live searches and create amazing workflows.

entry.title: Learn how to use Supertags in Tana (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Learn how to use Supertags in Tana

Understand the basics of how to use Tana's supertags.

entry.title: Using Tana's Live Search Feature (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Using Tana's Live Search Feature

Learn how to use Tana's live searches.

entry.title: Get oriented in Tana's UI (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Get oriented in Tana's UI

Get started with Tana by exploring its main UI and navigation features.

entry.title: Everything is a Node in Tana (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Everything is a Node in Tana

Learn how to use Tana's nodes.

entry.title: Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana

Learn how to leverage Tana's fields and tags to record data about individual nodes.

entry.title: New Time Units for Higher Productivity (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

New Time Units for Higher Productivity

Our common measures of time never worked for me for time management. So I invented my own.

entry.title: The Input Channel Audit (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

The Input Channel Audit

A quick How To guide for shaping your information diet

entry.title: Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage

'How in the world. You need less Twitter in your life.' I had, again, discarded my guard rails of attention design and failed at input triage.

entry.title: The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops

Personal Knowledge Management is too restrictive – you want to think about all seven of these questions instead.

entry.title: The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering

On the Internet, information is limitless. The Grazing-Feeding Model of Information Gathering helps you know how you're engaging with that information.

entry.title: Sadly, Constraints Are Real (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Constraints

Sadly, Constraints Are Real

For the last 15 years I've ignored one fundamental truth: real constraints exist. Here's what I'm trying now.

entry.title: Adversarial Reading (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

Adversarial Reading

Bullshit is everywhere, and these algorithms of thought help you do more adversarial reading.

entry.title: How to improve a process (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

How to improve a process

With taking notes as an example, let's talk about how to improve any process.

entry.title: Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Note-taking

Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System

You should stick to one note-taking system and fiddle with it as little as possible. That's a myth.

entry.title: Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Peer Review

Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals

Why to get rid of peer review and academic journals as we know them – and possibly what to do instead.

entry.title: You Actually Need to Context Switch (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

You Actually Need to Context Switch

Common wisdom says that you need to avoid context switching. That's only half true – sometimes you need to context switch.

entry.title: How to Context Switch Like a Pro (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

How to Context Switch Like a Pro

Context switching is unavoidable – but you can make it less costly by combining a couple of simple strategies.

entry.title: A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News

Counter two frequent biases while reading the news: Selection Bias and Description Bias.

entry.title: How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Interstitial Journaling

How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling

Interstitial Journaling is a great technique for minimizing context switching costs and staying productive. Here's how I use it in Roam Reserch.

entry.title: Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Academic Workflow

Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager

A guide to reference managers, what you should expect from them and why Zotero is the reference manager you should use - whether you're in academia or not.

entry.title: Behavior First, Theory Second (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Learning

Behavior First, Theory Second

Behavior and Theory are two heuristics that can help you in deciding between courses and teachers.

entry.title: True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived

Can you imagine being able to transfer 'mental software' between people? It's now possible, by using Algorithms of Thought in Roam Research.

entry.title: The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Programming Attention

The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research

How to use Roam Research as your keystone habit to regularly revisit writing that is important to you, using the ∆ feature in Roam.

entry.title: Zotero and Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Academic Workflow

Zotero and Roam Research

A guide for using Roam Research together with Zotero to get the most out of your citation metadata.

entry.title: A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Spaced Repetition

A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research

How to use Roam Research's new Delta feature to do Spaced Repetition and never forget anything again.

entry.title: My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Zettelkasten

My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper

My grandfather's way of doing history research before the computer age. Using paper and a meticulous process, he built something close to a Zettelkasten.

entry.title: How to cure Highlight Dementia (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

How to cure Highlight Dementia

How to make sure that you never lose insights when reading and highlighting. Because Highlight Dementia is completely preventable.

entry.title: Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery

How discovery became an actor's concept - and what you can use that for. Can you play chess without knowing that you are doing so?

entry.title: Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought

An introduction to Algorithms of Thought - how they differ from Mental Models and how to use them in Roam Research.

entry.title: Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Polymathy

Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures

There are words you can't use to describe yourself without sounding like an utter ass. Imagine asking someone at a party who they are and they respond with 'Nice to meet you, I'm a brilliant photographer/physicist/writer' - instant, life-long friends you'll be, no?

entry.title: The Right to Disagree (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

The Right to Disagree

Contrary to popular belief, you can't just disagree with someone because you feel like it. You have to __earn__ the right to disagree with someone's position.

entry.title: A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Roam Research

A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research

How to create a Gruvbox-style color theme for Roam Research using Roam's built-in CSS capabilities.

Anomalous intense coherent secondary photoemission from a perovskite oxide

  • Caiyun Hong
  • Wenjun Zou
  • Rui-Hua He
Article 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: Protomelission is an early dasyclad alga and not a Cambrian bryozoan (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Protomelission is an early dasyclad alga and not a Cambrian bryozoan

Protomelission-like macrofossils from the Xiaoshiba Lagerstätte show features characteristic of dasycladalean green alga, suggesting that Protomelission is unlikely to be an early bryozoan.

  • Jie Yang
  • Tian Lan
  • Martin R. Smith
Article 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: Multivariate BWAS can be replicable with moderate sample sizes (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Multivariate BWAS can be replicable with moderate sample sizes

  • Tamas Spisak
  • Ulrike Bingel
  • Tor D. Wager
Matters Arising Open Access 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: Reply to: Multivariate BWAS can be replicable with moderate sample sizes (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Reply to: Multivariate BWAS can be replicable with moderate sample sizes

  • Brenden Tervo-Clemmens
  • Scott Marek
  • Nico U. F. Dosenbach
Matters Arising Open Access 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: Population-based heteropolymer design to mimic protein mixtures (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Population-based heteropolymer design to mimic protein mixtures

Information from natural protein libraries was extracted and used to design heteropolymer ensembles as mixtures of disordered, partially folded and folded proteins, providing valuable guiding principles to synthetically realize protein properties.

  • Zhiyuan Ruan
  • Shuni Li
  • Ting Xu
Article 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: Structural basis for bacterial energy extraction from atmospheric hydrogen (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Structural basis for bacterial energy extraction from atmospheric hydrogen

Structural and biochemical studies of the Mycobacterium smegmatis hydrogenase Huc provides insights into how [NiFe] hydrogenases oxidize trace amounts of atmospheric hydrogen and transfer the electrons liberated via quinone transport.

  • Rhys Grinter
  • Ashleigh Kropp
  • Chris Greening
Article Open Access 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: An airway-to-brain sensory pathway mediates influenza-induced sickness (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
An airway-to-brain sensory pathway mediates influenza-induced sickness

A small population of prostaglandin E2-responsive glossopharyngeal sensory neurons provides a sensory pathway between airway and brainstem that mediates sickness responses to early-phase influenza virus infection.

  • Na-Ryum Bin
  • Sara L. Prescott
  • Stephen D. Liberles
Article Open Access 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: Macrophage fumarate hydratase restrains mtRNA-mediated interferon production (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Macrophage fumarate hydratase restrains mtRNA-mediated interferon production

Inhibition of the tricarboxylic acid cycle enzyme fumarate hydratase leads to deregulation of cytokine production in macrophages, which has implications in human diseases such as systemic lupus erythematosus.

  • Alexander Hooftman
  • Christian G. Peace
  • Luke A. J. O’Neill
Article 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: Autoregulation of GPCR signalling through the third intracellular loop (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Autoregulation of GPCR signalling through the third intracellular loop

Biochemical and molecular dynamics studies show that the third intracellular loop of G protein-coupled receptors autoregulates the receptor activity and tunes the signalling specificity by controlling access to the G protein-binding site.

  • Fredrik Sadler
  • Ning Ma
  • Sivaraj Sivaramakrishnan
Article Open Access 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: The giant diploid faba genome unlocks variation in a global protein crop (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
The giant diploid faba genome unlocks variation in a global protein crop

Using a high-quality chromosome-scale assembly of the faba bean genome, the genetic basis of seed size and hilum colour is explored.

  • Murukarthick Jayakodi
  • Agnieszka A. Golicz
  • Stig Uggerhøj Andersen
Article Open Access 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: Basin-scale reconstruction of euxinia and Late Devonian mass extinctions (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Basin-scale reconstruction of euxinia and Late Devonian mass extinctions

A spatial and temporal compilation of geochemical data documents a stepwise transgression of toxic euxinic waters into shallow oceans that drove a series of Late Devonian extinction events.

  • Swapan K. Sahoo
  • Geoffrey J. Gilleaudeau
  • Alan J. Kaufman
Article 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: Neoantigen-targeted CD8+ T cell responses with PD-1 blockade therapy (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Neoantigen-targeted CD8+ T cell responses with PD-1 blockade therapy

Effective anti-PD-1 immunotherapy is associated with the presence of polyclonal CD8+ T cells in the tumour and blood specific for a limited number of immunodominant mutations, which are recurrently recognized over time.

  • Cristina Puig-Saus
  • Barbara Sennino
  • Antoni Ribas
Article 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: Evidence of near-ambient superconductivity in a N-doped lutetium hydride (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Evidence of near-ambient superconductivity in a N-doped lutetium hydride

A nitrogen-doped lutetium hydride was synthesized under high-pressure high-temperature conditions and, following full recoverability, examination along compression pathways showed evidence of superconductivity at room temperature and near-ambient pressures.

  • Nathan Dasenbrock-Gammon
  • Elliot Snider
  • Ranga P. Dias
Article 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: Fumarate induces vesicular release of mtDNA to drive innate immunity (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Fumarate induces vesicular release of mtDNA to drive innate immunity

Fumarate metabolism regulates the innate immune response through a mechanism in which high levels of fumarate result in the generation of mitochondrial-derived vesicles and the release of mitochondrial DNA into the cytosol, which activates inflammatory pathways.

  • Vincent Zecchini
  • Vincent Paupe
  • Christian Frezza
Article Open Access 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: Co-opting signalling molecules enables logic-gated control of CAR T cells (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Co-opting signalling molecules enables logic-gated control of CAR T cells

Logic gating is used to develop a CAR T cell platform that is highly specific and allows the activity of T cells to be restricted to the encounter of two antigens, thus reducing on-target, off-tumour toxicity.

  • Aidan M. Tousley
  • Maria Caterina Rotiroti
  • Robbie G. Majzner
Article 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: Chlorine activation and enhanced ozone depletion induced by wildfire aerosol (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Chlorine activation and enhanced ozone depletion induced by wildfire aerosol

Comparison of model simulations with atmospheric observations from the Southern Hemisphere mid-latitudes following the 2020 Australian wildfires shows that the wildfire aerosol composition promotes stratospheric chlorine and ozone depletion chemistry.

  • Susan Solomon
  • Kane Stone
  • Peidong Wang
Article 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: Deuterium-enriched water ties planet-forming disks to comets and protostars (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Deuterium-enriched water ties planet-forming disks to comets and protostars

Direct detection of gas phase water from the disk of V883 Ori indicates that disks directly inherit water from the star-forming cloud that becomes incorporated into large icy bodies without notable chemical alteration.

  • John J. Tobin
  • Merel L. R. van ’t Hoff
  • Lucas Cieza
Article 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: Human–machine collaboration for improving semiconductor process development (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Human–machine collaboration for improving semiconductor process development

A virtual process game to benchmark the performance of humans and computers for the fabrication of semiconductors leads to a strategy combining human expert design with optimization algorithms to improve semiconductor process development.

  • Keren J. Kanarik
  • Wojciech T. Osowiecki
  • Richard A. Gottscho
Article Open Access 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: Microglia-mediated T cell infiltration drives neurodegeneration in tauopathy (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Microglia-mediated T cell infiltration drives neurodegeneration in tauopathy

A study finds T cells in areas of tau, not amyloid, pathology in Alzheimer’s disease brain and mouse models, with their presence correlating with neuronal loss and their depletion, or that of microglia, preventing neurodegeneration and cognitive decline.

  • Xiaoying Chen
  • Maria Firulyova
  • David M. Holtzman
Article 08 Mar 2023

entry.title: Diode effect in Josephson junctions with a single magnetic atom (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Diode effect in Josephson junctions with a single magnetic atom

By analysing atomic-scale Pb–Pb Josephson junctions including magnetic atoms in a scanning tunnelling microscope, a new mechanism for diode behaviour is demonstrated, opening up new paths to tune their properties by means of single-atom manipulation.

  • Martina Trahms
  • Larissa Melischek
  • Katharina J. Franke
Article Open Access 08 Mar 2023
